name: Slow Cooker Roast Beef in its own Gravy
author: Heather Dunn
summary: This is my go-to recipe for pot roast on a busy weekday. It uses inexpensive cuts of meat, made posh by the slow cooker. After years of tweaking others' recipes, I think I found a good mix of high-quality pot roast while still being very quick and easy.
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
1 (1.5 ounce) package beef stew seasoning mix
1 (1 ounce) envelope onion soup mix (such as Lipton® Beefy Onion)
directions: Arrange potatoes, carrots, and onion around the edges of a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker
Whisk celery soup and beef stew seasoning mix together in a bowl until smooth and creamy
Heat a saucepan over medium-high heat; cook roast until browned and seared, about 3 minutes per side
Sprinkle onion soup mix over entire roast and place roast in the center of the slow cooker, surrounding it with the vegetable mixture
Spread celery soup mixture over roast
Remove roast from the slow cooker and place on cutting board; let rest for 10 minutes
Strain remaining liquid in the slow cooker into a bowl and whisk until smooth, about 1 minute
Slice roast and serve alongside vegetables and gravy
